story: Bob was feeling very tired everyday. He decided to live a healthier lifestyle. Bob eliminated all processed foods from his diet. Bob started eating fruits and vegetables in all his meals.
choice1: Bob had more energy after changing his diet.
choice2: Unfortunately, Bob's new diet made him even more tired than before.

story: Bobby always wanted a drone he could fly around his yard. Bobby dropped hints to his parents about the drone. Bobby wrote a letter to Santa about the drone. He finally awoke on Christmas morning and unwrapped a box.
choice1: It was a huge state of the art drone!
choice2: To his surprise, Bobby opened the box to find a pair of socks.

story: Selena got a shiny new scooter for Christmas. She raced it down the driveway in front of her house. This time, she left the kickstand down, and didn't realize it. She put her foot down to kick, and the kickstand stabbed her.
choice1: She began to bleed but her mom was there to help clean the wound.
choice2: She panicked and ran inside, leaving a trail of blood behind her.

story: Bob groggily poured a bowl of cereal. He then remembered he'd finished the last carton of rice milk. He'd forgotten to put a new carton in the fridge so it'd be cold. Bob put a container of room temperature rice milk into the freezer.
choice1: After half an hour it was cold enough to have on his cereal.
choice2: As soon as Bob removed the container from the freezer, it exploded, drenching him and the kitchen in rice milk.

story: Tina was a horrible car accident. Her legs were messed up terribly. Doctors said she would never walk again. But Tina persevered in therapy.
choice1: And she regained the ability to walk again.
choice2: And unfortunately, she had to rely on a wheelchair for the rest of her life.

story: Diana sneezed in class. Everyone immediately said bless you. On the other hand, I sneezed and got no response. I became more suspicious when the event happened again.
choice1: Instead of being mad, I assumed that they were not mad at me.
choice2: I confronted the class and accused them of being biased against me and purposely ignoring my sneezes.

story: Bob planted some trees when he bought his house. He tended to them year after year. Bob didn't notice them growing because he saw them every day. Bob decided to sell his house after a decade.
choice1: The buyers all complimented his mature shade trees.
choice2: The buyers were disappointed to see the dead and withered trees in the backyard.

story: There was a new grocery store in town. Kate decided to visit to compare the prices to her usual store. She found the sale prices to be lower. But the non-sale prices were always higher than she was used to.
choice1: Kate decided to stay with the tried and true store instead.
choice2: Kate was so convinced by the low sale prices that she decided to give up her usual store and shop at the new grocery store permanently, even though it was more expensive.

story: Jill went to the doctor for her annual exam. A lump was found on her breast and she needed more testing. She went to a follow up appointment and it was confirmed as cancer. Jill went through several rounds of chemotherapy.
choice1: Fortunately, she had no signs of cancer following her treatment.
choice2: Sadly, the cancer had spread throughout her body and she passed away shortly after her treatment.

story: Lily and Pam were popular girls in school. They invited Joy to a diner after school. Joy was not popular and Lily and Pam knew it. They invited her just to bully her when they got there!
choice1: Joy had brought a gun and shot both the bullies in the face.
choice2: Joy enjoyed spending time with her best friends Lily and Pam.

story: Bob was on the phone all day. It was raining something fierce when he finally wasn't. Bob was sad he hadn't been able to go for his daily walk. When it stopped raining he saw there was a full moon.
choice1: Bob went for his walk at midnight and was happy.
choice2: Bob went outside and was attacked by a pack of stray dogs.

story: Our friends gathered around the campfire to make s'mores. My marshmallow caught on fire. I couldn't stop laughing long enough to blow out the flame. My marshmallow was completely burnt and black.
choice1: Jimmy said he'd eat it because he likes them burnt.
choice2: The burnt marshmallow caused a wildfire that destroyed the entire forest.

story: I partied all day and all of the night. I got so inebriated that I couldn't feel my face. Because of it I lost my job and my friends. That just made me want to drink more.
choice1: I stopped denying I had a problem and enrolled into a facility.
choice2: I continued down this path of self-destruction, embracing my addiction and soon became known as the ultimate party animal in town.

story: Heather and her family really wanted tacos for dinner. Two of the children wanted chicken tacos. The other two children wanted beef. Heather took great care preparing all the tacos that each wanted.
choice1: Everyone sat down at dinner and enjoyed eating the tacos together.
choice2: Heather accidentally mixed up the orders and the children ended up with tacos filled with tofu, which they all hated and refused to eat.

story: Justin decided to make dinner for his boyfriend. He went to the store and bought all of the ingredients. He started cooking but got distracted. The entire meal was burnt.
choice1: Justin ordered pizza instead.
choice2: Justin served the burnt meal to his boyfriend who loved it so much that he proposed to him.

story: Ed was supposed to work today. But it was sunny and beautiful outside! He decided to play hooky from work. He packed up his car to spend the day at the beach.
choice1: He had to explain his tan the next day at the office.
choice2: Ed was able to get in a full day's work.

story: Cara had been faithful to her boyfriend tommy. They had been together for 2 years. Never once did they cheat on each other. One night Cara met up with an ex boyfriend Richard.
choice1: She still had feelings for him and was all alone with Him.
choice2: Cara realized that her true love was actually Richard and she broke up with Tommy to be with him.

story: My friend Jess texted me some photos of Denver. She was visiting from NH and was at Union Station. She knew I loved trains and sent me some photos. I thanked her very much and asked how she was doing.
choice1: She said she loved being in Denver.
choice2: She replied that she missed her flight back to NH and was stranded in Denver for days.

story: Ida had to do an oral report. She was very nervous. At first she was hesitant and stuttered. But then she began to speak confidently.
choice1: In the end, her report was graded very highly!
choice2: Unfortunately, Ida's nervousness got the best of her and she ended up fainting in front of the entire audience.

story: David was faced a particularly difficult exam. He expected to just pass based on it. However, he saw a person carelessly showing his exam. Noble David decided to not cheat.
choice1: Unfortunately, David did not pass this difficult exam.
choice2: David decided to cheat after all and was caught by the teacher, resulting in his expulsion from school.

story: Ted is driving his car down the road. He starts to feel a bad rumble. He pulls over to check it out. There was a nail in his tire.
choice1: Ted couldn't believe his luck as he called triple a.
choice2: Ted decided to continue driving on the flat tire and ended up getting into a terrible accident.

story: Charles had always wanted to learn to play tennis. He and a friend decided to buy rackets and play a game. At first, Charles found it difficult. However, he gradually improved.
choice1: Charles was happy to be learning to play tennis.
choice2: Charles accidentally hit his friend in the face with the tennis ball and decided he didn't want to play anymore.

story: I was ill-prepared for my final exam coming up. I decided to make a cheat sheet to use in class. I was nervous but needed an A. I put my cheat sheet in my palm and used it.
choice1: The teacher caught and suspended me.
choice2: I was very proud of myself.

story: Erik was addiction to several kinds of drugs. His life had gotten away from him, due to years of abuse. He hated himself, and delved deeper into darkness. When 9/11 happened, his eyes began to open to the kindness of humanity.
choice1: He straightened out and never touched drugs again.
choice2: He continued to spiral downward, losing all contact with reality and eventually succumbing to his addiction.

story: Tom met his ex-boyfriend online when he was 16. He moved to Ohio to live with him. Tom went to college and made lots of friends. They broke up after 5 years together.
choice1: Tom stayed in Ohio because of the life he had built there.
choice2: Tom regretted moving to Ohio and decided to move back home, leaving behind all the friends he had made and the life he had built.

story: A girl falls in love with a boy and he liked her too. She finds out that their parents don't get along. The boy and the girl love each other so much. But, they don't want to hurt their parents feelings so they stay away
choice1: But eventually they get together anyway.
choice2: The boy and girl's parents are very happy they love each other.

story: Elena was in the grocery store, looking for jelly. She accidentally backed into a shelf. Six jars of jam fell to the ground with a smash, spilling everywhere. Elena was forced to pay for six jars of jam.
choice1: She never found the jelly.
choice2: Elena slipped on the jam and broke her leg, resulting in a hefty medical bill on top of the six jars of jam she had to pay for.

story: Jimmy and Timmy both loved to bowl. Jimmy got more strikes but Timmy had higher scores. They decided to enter a doubles tournament together. Jimmy practiced hard and Timmy practiced hard.
choice1: When the tournament day arrived, they bowled well and won 5th place.
choice2: When the tournament day arrived, Jimmy woke up with the flu and couldn't even get out of bed, so Timmy had to find a new partner at the last minute and they got dead last.

story: I got a new kitten. The kitten was bad. It ate my shoes. I then trained it to be good.
choice1: It was a good kitten from then on.
choice2: However, one day the kitten ran away and never came back, leaving me with a pile of ruined shoes and a broken heart.

story: Tony made a huge batch of waffles. He called his family to the breakfast table. They all gobbled them up. They told Tony to make waffles every Saturday morning.
choice1: He was happy to make it a tradition!
choice2: However, soon after, Tony started to despise making waffles every Saturday morning and began to resent his family for making him do it.

story: Maddie's family went strawberry picking. They collected four big cartons. When they got home her mom started work on making jelly. They had so much they couldn't possibly eat it all.
choice1: So all their friends got jelly at Christmas time that year.
choice2: But they ended up throwing all the strawberries away because they forgot them in the trunk of the car.

story: Katherine was very nervous. The day of the audition had arrived. She had been dancing all her life and was ready for the challenge. They called her name and she began to dance.
choice1: The judges were blown away.
choice2: Katherine tripped and fell, embarrassing herself in front of the judges and ruining her chances of getting the part.

story: Whitney was meeting her best friend for dinner. They had agreed on a Mexican restaurant. Whitney got there first and reserved a table. Brooke called Whitney to ask where she was.
choice1: They apparently went to the same place but in different towns.
choice2: Brooke got mad that Whitney chose a Mexican restaurant instead of Italian, and cancelled the dinner plans.

story: I woke up early yesterday because I was going on a trip. I got dressed. I drove to Dunn's river falls. I explored the falls.
choice1: I went home exhausted.
choice2: I slipped and fell into the water, but luckily I was able to swim to the top and continue exploring the falls with ease.

story: Marlene took her dog for a walk. While they were out, Marlene got violently ill. A kind motorist stopped and offered to help. He drove Marlene to the Emergency Room.
choice1: She was in the hospital for a whole week!
choice2: The kind motorist turned out to be a notorious criminal who kidnapped Marlene and her dog, never to be seen again.

story: Arnold was scared of cats. He thinks all of them are creepy. One day he visited his girlfriend's house. His girlfriend has a cat.
choice1: Arnold loved his girlfriend's cats.
choice2: Arnold dumped his girlfriend.

story: Laura had a passion for art. She would paint everyday after class. She painted a self portrait of herself one day. She posted it online for everyone to see.
choice1: Laura was pleased to show people her art.
choice2: Laura never painted again.

story: Before she left, she promised him that one day she would be back. She had important things to take care of far away. He missed her and she really missed him. Someday she would be back, he told himself.
choice1: He hoped that she never came back.
choice2: A year later she returned.

story: Maria went to pick up her food from the restaurant. She went in the restaurant and walked to the counter. She told the people at the restaurant that she had placed an order. The restaurant owners told her to wait for five minutes.
choice1: Maria sat down and waited.
choice2: Maria got frustrated and started yelling at the restaurant owners, causing a scene.

story: Tyler needed some extra spending money. He began looking for after-school jobs. Finally, he found a job at the local cafe. He makes coffee and bagels for customers.
choice1: He likes all the money he has now.
choice2: It was the most delicious bagel he ever had.

story: Tasha wasn't a very good cook. Every time she tried cooking, something went wrong. Tasha attempted cooking spaghetti for her friends. The spaghetti sauce was very runny and gross.
choice1: Tasha and her friends decided to go to a restaurant instead.
choice2: Tasha's friends still insisted on eating her spaghetti, even though it tasted like dish soap.

story: Jim got his first credit card in college. He didn't have a job so he bought everything on his card. After he graduated he amounted a $10,000 debt. Jim realized that he was foolish to spend so much money.
choice1: Jim decided to devise a plan for repayment.
choice2: Jim decided to open another credit card.

story: Bob's stomach was really bothering him after the big meal. A friend he had dined with called to say she was feeling ill, too. They decided the seafood they'd eaten had been bad. Sometime later, Bob finally threw up the contents of his stomach.
choice1: Bob will be careful that he never eats at that restaurant again.
choice2: Bob's decision to embezzle from his employer was a mistake.

story: It was a beautiful spring day in early March. Tracey decided to go for a walk in the woods behind her house. She was heard a woodpecker and began looking for it in the trees. She tripped over a root and fell on the path.
choice1: Tracey ran back home.
choice2: Tracey shrugged off her fall.

story: The other night my husband and I met our friend Greg for pizza. Greg ordered a pizza with anchovies, olives, and sun-dried tomatoes. Greg offered my husband a slice. Neither of them could eat more than one slice because it was so salty!
choice1: They ate the entire pizza in one sitting.
choice2: They ended up taking the pizza to go.

story: Miles noticed that his breath smelled bad. He decided to get some gum to chew. Miles bought a pack of strawberry flavored gum. He began to chew one stick of the gum.
choice1: Soon he noticed that his breath did not smell bad any longer.
choice2: However, the strawberry flavored gum made his breath smell even worse than before and people started to avoid him.

story: Amy wanted to make waffles for breakfast. She whipped up some batter quickly. She poured the batter into the maker. When she was eating them there were lumps of the dry batter.
choice1: Amy was disappointed.
choice2: Amy thought they tasted great.

story: Gina was at her uncle's house out of state. Her parents were in the living room playing music. In the kitchen, there was a beer can on the counter. She thought about taking a sip.
choice1: She decided it would be wrong to drink it.
choice2: She poured the beer on the floor.

story: When the waiter returned to the table the customers looked ready. She asked the woman what she wanted to eat. The woman began to speak and then stopped. She was no longer sure what she wanted.
choice1: The waiter put the order in.
choice2: The waiter gave them more time.

story: I wanted to eat a particular cereal for breakfast. I found that I had run out of that particular brand of cereal. I went to a store to buy some more. The store was also out of that brand and I had to buy another.
choice1: I don't like cereal.
choice2: I liked the new brand that I bought.

story: Brandon was given a ten-page research paper to write for class. He began working on the paper on his 2003 Dell laptop. Brandon stayed up until 1 in the morning to try and finish his paper. Suddenly, his computer crashed and died.
choice1: When he finished his paper he went to bed.
choice2: Luckily, he had been saving everything on an external disk.

story: Jay got stuck in an elevator on his way out of his office. It stopped between floors and the lights flickered. Jay was terrified! He battled his claustrophobia for two hours.
choice1: After two hours firefighters came and rescued Jay.
choice2: Jay laid down and took a nap.

story: Fred noticed that he feet got very hot in the summer. He decided he needed new footwear. Fred invested in a nice new pair of sandals. He loved wearing his new sandals.
choice1: Fred was glad that his feet no longer got hot in the summer.
choice2: However, Fred soon realized that his new sandals caused blisters on his feet and made his previous problem even worse.

story: My sister and I were walking to our uncle's house. We passed a super cute kitten walking in the middle of the road. It followed us all the way to my uncle's home. He was allergic to dander.
choice1: We kept the kitten.
choice2: My uncle adopted the kitten.

story: Bill went fishing and caught a lot of fish. He caught so many he had to give some away. His neighbors were poor and were grateful to Bill for the fish. The neighbors finally got back on their feet.
choice1: Bill's neighbors sued him for making them poor.
choice2: They baked Bill some bread in appreciation for all the fish.

story: Eddie's dad took him to a wrestling show. Eddie loved the whole show! Afterward, he got a wrestler's autograph. He decided wrestlers were the best guys ever.
choice1: Eddie never watched wrestling again.
choice2: Eddie had the best day with his dad!

story: Lena was sick. Lena was sad because she wouldn't see her friends at school. So she took her vitamins. She got better quickly
choice1: Lena went to school only to find out her friends were sick.
choice2: Lena pretended to be sick so she could avoid her friends.

story: One day Wesley's auntie came over to visit. He was happy to see her because he liked to play with her. When she starting to give his little sister attention, he got jealous. He got angry at his auntie and bit her hand when she wasn't looking.
choice1: He was scolded.
choice2: She gave him a cookie for being so nice.

story: Doug liked his neighbor's dog and really wanted one of his own. He called all the shelters. He looked online, but there were none to be found. His neighbor could not keep her dog due to illness.
choice1: Doug got a great dog, after all.
choice2: The illness was from the dog.

story: Amy came home from school on her birthday to an empty house. She was upset that everyone had forgotten her special day. She walked sadly into the living room. Suddenly, her friends and family jumped out from their hiding spots.
choice1: Amy grinned with delight.
choice2: Amy walked out of the room and left the house.

story: Tina auditioned for her high school dancing team. After she danced, the instructor wanted to talk to her. He said that her skills aren't good enough to make the team. She immediately left the auditioning room.
choice1: Tina held back her tears.
choice2: Tina joined the high school dancing team.

story: Bryan wondered why his arms itched. He scratched his arms until they left scars because it was so bad. He finally went to the doctor and he found out he had poison ivy. The doctor gave him ointment and some antibiotics.
choice1: Bryan went home in pain.
choice2: Bryan went home relieved.

story: Lorraine always wanted to make biscuits the way her mother used to. She decides to take a month away from work and only make biscuits. Finally she has perfected her biscuit recipe. She brings her mother a biscuit and her mother says it is delicious.
choice1: Lorraine is pleased.
choice2: Lorraine is disappointed.

story: I opened the door of the classroom and walked inside. I sat in my desk and quietly took out my textbook to review. And then I took some deep breaths and remained positive. I studied ahead of time and I knew I will do well.
choice1: After I received my test back, I had a great score.
choice2: After I received my test back, I saw I had failed.

story: Craig just graduated high school and wants a job. He gets the daily newspaper and checks out the help wanted ads. He draws up his resume. One of the people, where he applies, calls him for an interview.
choice1: Craig calls the person back and tells them to stop harassing him.
choice2: He calls them back and schedules an interview.

story: Matt decided to go bar hopping with his two friends one night. They drank 3 shots in one bar. They went to 4 more, drinking 3 shots in each. Matt ended up getting too drunk and lost his phone.
choice1: Matt and friends walked home and slept it off.
choice2: Matt did not care about the missing phone.

story: The city was bustling. People were pushing against each other to see the ball drop. They started a riot trying to get a good view. However, it started to calm down.
choice1: An alien ship appeared and abducted some people.
choice2: The ball lit up as the countdown started.

story: James was at the gym playing basketball. His clothes were soaked from running up and down the court. He forgot to bring spare clothes to change into. James had to run to his car in order to avoid the cold weather.
choice1: James drove home with the car window open.
choice2: James drove home to get change into dry clothes.

story: I went to leave for work this morning when I noticed it snowed a lot. I was worried about how dangerous the roads would be. I cleaned off my car and started on my way. The roads were very slippery, but I drove cautiously.
choice1: I got to work earlier than usual.
choice2: After a half hour, I finally made it safely to work!

story: The family always went to church together. One week, they sat in the back pew. When the service was almost over, they snuck out. It was easy to get out of the parking lot quickly that way.
choice1: They decided to sit there every week after that.
choice2: They got into a car accident while leaving the parking lot quickly.

story: I went to the store for asparagus. I walked to the produce section. I looked everywhere and couldn't find any. I asked an employee and he said they were out.
choice1: I then kept looking for asparagus.
choice2: I then settled for broccoli.

story: My daughter was celebrating her sixth birthday. We decided to have a party for her and her friends at an art studio. All her friends arrived and waited for the instructions. Each friend listened to directions on how to paint their picture.
choice1: After listening, the kids then made wonderful art.
choice2: The kids then began to write their own songs.

story: Cornelia decides that she wants to rearrange her apartment. Her bed has stood next to the wall for many Year's. Cornelia moves her bed to sit next to the window. When her friends sees her new arrangement, they love it.
choice1: Cornelia then moved her bed back to where it was.
choice2: Soon all her friends had arranged their beds the same way.

story: Marc always had perfect attendance at school. One day, he stopped coming to class. Everyone was worried about him! He came back a few days later.
choice1: He had been in bed with the flu.
choice2: He had won the lottery and decided to drop out of school and travel the world.

story: Mia is very beautiful. Mia stays in good shape and eats healthy. Because of Mia's good looks, she decides to become a model. Mia moves to New York to pursue modeling.
choice1: Mia walked the runway in her first fashion show last week.
choice2: Mia was rejected by all the modeling agencies and decided to become a street performer instead.
